newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal bond auction seen around secondary levels.
newsitem.headline: Portugal bond auction seen around secondary levels.

text.p: Portugal's Public Credit Management Institute (IGCP) was expected to place all 25 billion escudos of 10-year fixed rate bonds at today's auction at close to secondary market levels, dealers said.
Results of the auction are due around 1100 GMT.

"Today's auction does not come at a good time because in the last few days most markets were closed, but it is clear that the IGCP will accept bids at around the secondary market level," said one dealer.
Another said: "We have until 1000 a.m. (local time) this morning to see how other markets opened, to help us decide at what levels to bid."
At the last auction at which bids were accepted on February 14, the average weighted interest rate was 6.6993 percent.
Ten-year bonds closed last Thursday to yield 6.9 percent.
